qas.question: What has positive consequences for the birth ratio?

context: The Thuringian population has a significant sex ratio gap, caused by the <a1_0><b5_0>emigration of young women<b5_0/><a1_0/>, especially in rural areas. Overall, <b8_0>there are <a0_0><b4_0>115 to 120 men per 100 women<a0_0/> in the 25–40 age group<b8_0/><b4_0/> ("family founders") which has negative consequences for the birth ratio. Furthermore, the population is getting older and older with some rural municipalities recording <a2_0><b6_0>more than 30%<b6_0/><a2_0/> of over-65s (pensioners). This is a problem for the regional labour market, as <a3_0><b7_0>there are twice as many people leaving as entering the job market annually<b7_0/>.
